title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: At luncheon, a Mrs Fraser, a very distinguished-lookingEdinburgh lady, with her daughter, came to Avonbank.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: I was again at Stratford-on-Avon at the close of thatmonth, the guest of the kind Charles Flowers at Avonbank, and had the satisfaction of showing my monumentof Shakespeare to my nephew Lome, who, on his way to apolitical meeting at Birmingham, broke his journey atStratford-on-Avon, a place which, like so many Englishmen who should know better, he had never visited.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: I breakfasted at Avonbank,where I met Henry Irving and Dr Macaulay.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: Irving is the guestof the Charles Flowers at Avonbank.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: Here I am again, for the third time this year, atStratford-on-Avon, but not as on the two previousoccasions, with the hospitable Charles Flowers of Avonbank, but with the Mayor, Sir Arthur Hodgson, at historic

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: My bedroom window atAvonbank commands a lovely view of the Avon and the

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: I had been atAvonbank some four or five years ago, when I came herewith J. O'Connor, my artist friend, and Dr Becker, whobrought with him the " Kesselstadt " death mask ofShakespeare, as we believed it to be.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: The church ison the right, within a stone's-throw of Avonbank, and allaround are fine cedars and beech trees.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: His house isclose to the station, Avonbank its name ; it faces theriver which runs at the foot of the garden.
